definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: Whoever corrects a scoffer wins abuse; whoever rebukes the wicked gets hurt.
sentences.chinese: 指斥褻慢人的必受辱罵，責備惡人的必被玷污。

sentences.english: In the meanwhile, they also point out and criticize Qianlong's arbitrary decisions and peremptory actions.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，他們也指斥了乾隆的專橫獨斷等行爲。

sentences.english: But the fingerpointing really goes wild when it comes to venereal disease.
sentences.chinese: 不過，當涉及到性病的時候這種指斥真的就野了些。

sentences.english: No invention has received more praise and punishment than Internet.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一項出景色互聯網同時遭到如此多的讚頌和指斥。

definition: to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
to frame/to bring false charges against
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)
